question: The number of atoms in 4.5 g of a face-centred cubic crystal with edge length 300 pm is: (Given density = <katex>$10 \ g \ cm^{-3}$</katex> and <katex>$N_{A}=6.022 \times 10^{23}$</katex>).
explanation: We calculate molar mass <katex>$M$</katex> using <katex>$\rho = \frac{Z M}{N_A a^3}$</katex>. For FCC, Z=4. Solving gives <katex>$M \approx 40.5 \ g/mol$</katex>. Then, number of atoms = <katex>$\frac{4.5}{40.5} \times 6.022 \times 10^{23} \approx 6.6 \times 10^{22}$</katex>.
